lines.text: Have a popover, froggy!
Never kiss a frog, Malora! You'll get warts on your lips!
I'm valiant and daring/And noble of bearing,/Couragous and gallant,/A mountain of talent./No wonder folks curtsy and wave/I'm Robin, Sir Robin, the Brave.
You're also a frog.
Bake the hall in the candle of her brain!
Mercy, makes a cute little frog, doesn't he?
Oh yes, nice frogy frog. No princy prince now!

Don't look so worried, little frogy. There's still a way you can break the spell. I mean, you might just happen to meet a princess. And she might befriend you and take you to live in the palace, and someday she just might kiss you. Then you'll be a prince again.
[laughs]
Doesn't seem so likely, does it?
Oh, froggy frog nice. Cute froggy frog.
Oh, Sweetums, you old bunnykins, do you like the froggy?
Yes, yes. Froggy frog nice.
Why don't you keep him? He could be your pet, your friend, your...
Breakfast!
That too!
A frog does not dog-paddle!
Will you stop talking about the princess? You know, she's not even green.
Oh! I want to quee the been!
My dear, if it were up to me, you could quee all the beans you wanted to... whatever that means.
You're crazy; you can't swim!
But if I go back on my word it will be... unprincely.
And if you drown it'll be unfrogly.
I bet you'd like me if I were a prince.
Well, my, my. So, you have a new pet, Malora. What a sweet little frog, what a dear little frog, what a familiar little frog.

[to King Rupert II]
He's a drog, fatty.
You mean he was the toad prince all along?
I'm sorry, but if you're really my sister, I'm afraid I need proof.
Well, all right, good King Rupert the Second. What was the name of your father?
King Rupert the First!
So was mine!
Sister!
Brother!
SWEETUMS EAT FROGGY NOW!

[Robin has just told a sad story about how he was a prince turned into a frog]
Yeah, we frogs just love fairytales!
